title.narrative: OP1: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN SCHOOLS AND Early Child Development (ECD) CENTRES

description.narrative: By 2021, Ministries and departments at national and sub national level have increased capacity to deliver and monitor water, sanitation and hygiene services and promote hygiene behaviors among children in rural primary schools and Early Child Development (ECD) centers, which contributes to Evaluation And Research, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children and their families have equitable access to and use of sustainable improved water sources, sanitation facilities, and adopt hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Ministries and departments at national and sub national level have increased capacity to deliver and monitor water,sanitation and hygiene services and promote hygiene behaviors among children in rural primary schools and ECD centers

description.narrative: Technical support to the Back-to-School campaign facilitated the safe return to school of 1.4 million schoolchildren following the second COVID-19 national lockdown. In partnership with GIZ, UNICEF supported the scaling-up of the Three Star Approach, further facilitating a safe school environment. Nearly all provinces have received training and data has been collected across one-third of schools in the country. Together with incorporation of the WinS Standards into national hygiene education, UNICEF is supporting a safer school environment for all children in the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2022
